alert.note: Alert for Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 7:02PM EDT until August 04 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL OTSEGO COUNTY... At 702 PM EDT, Emergency management reported flash flooding is occurring in multiple areas, especially around Edmeston along Route 80. The thunderstorms that produced the heavy rain have moved out of the warned area. However, between 4 and 5 inches of rain has fallen and water may continue to rise over the next hour. Flash flooding is occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cooperstown, Hartwick, Edmeston, Pittsfield, New Berlin, Milford, Bowerstown, Westville, Burlington, Index, Toddsville, South Edmeston and Lambs Corners. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
